result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie J. McCarthy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/treatment of combination, and if not so fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA at agent's discretion.  

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie J. McCarthy

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:45 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Joseph Kaupie by video conferencing. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

State moves to AMEND Count 3 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/PTAC/Repeater) to Misd. Possession of Controlled Substance under 961.41(3g)(b); COURT GRANTS.  

PLEA: 

Count 2 (Possession of THC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
Count 3 (Possession of Controlled Substance)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on each count: SWH for 18 months probation. 
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA at agent's discretion. Maintain FTW/School/treatment or combination, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.   

Adj:  2:01 p.m.
Re: Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Clerk: Amy.
Case Called:  8:45 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for bond forfeiture hearing.
**COURT quashes warrant* 

COURT questions Defendant re: missed appearance.  Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS bond reinstated.  

COURT sets plea/sentencing for 8/09/22 at 1:45 p.m. 

Adj:  8:47 a.m.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Case Called: 3:25 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person for ADA Lacey Coonen.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.
COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 
VRCW.  

BOND: 
$600 Signature Bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- Same Conditions. 

DATES:
BFH 07/07 @ 8:30 am

Branch 4 File.

Warrant to be reissued to be able to generate form
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:44 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant fails to appear. 
Atty Rick Cveykus appears on defendant's behalf. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing.  
Atty Cveykus has no information to provide to the Court.  
State is requesting warrant. 

COURT authorizes $100.00 bench warrant and sets BFH 7/07/22 at 8:30 a.m. 

Adj:  3;45 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Clerk: Amy.

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
State recites plea offer for Court; Defendant is not understanding terms of plea agreement. 
Atty Cveykus is requesting more time to go over with defendant.    

COURT directs parties to reset with JA after hearing.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
